subject: Gardening
title: The White House Kitchen Garden
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The White House Kitchen Garden.

hook.text: In 2009, Michelle Obama dug up 1,100 square feet of White House lawn to plant vegetables. Critics erupted.

buildup.text: The last significant White House garden was Eleanor Roosevelt's Victory Garden during WWII.

climax.text: The garden sparked a national conversation about food, health, and who controls what Americans eat.

punchline.text: A vegetable garden became America's hottest political debate.

quiz.question: Why did some corporate interests oppose Michelle Obama's White House kitchen garden?
options: They feared it would promote organic gardening over industrial agriculture
The garden used too much water during a drought
They wanted the space used for a golf course instead
